definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The injured wrist began to swell(up).
sentences.chinese: 受伤的腕子开始肿了起来。

sentences.english: He made me take off the rattles and tie them around his wrist, too.
sentences.chinese: 他叫我取下尾巴上的响鳞，他缠到了他的手腕子上。

sentences.english: Your ankle is badly swollen; I think the doctor ought to look at it.
sentences.chinese: 你的脚腕子肿得很厉害，我看得请医生看看。

sentences.english: Casy's strong fingers blundered over to Grandpa's wrist…
sentences.chinese: 凯绥有力的指头无意中又摸到爷爷的手腕子上。

sentences.english: He winced as the dog nipped his ankle.
sentences.chinese: 狗咬了他的脚腕子，疼得他龇牙咧嘴。

sentences.english: The wearer can grasp the leather strap and keep weight off of the wrists.
sentences.chinese: 穿戴者能掌握皮带和保留重量腕子。

sentences.english: The dog was nipping at her ankles.
sentences.chinese: 那狗咬着她的脚腕子了。

sentences.english: He swayed slightly, as if about to fall.
sentences.chinese: 她准是跌倒时把脚腕子给产歪了。

sentences.english: He hitched his pack farther over on his left shoulder, so as to take a portion of its weight from off the injured ankle.
sentences.chinese: 他把背包向左肩挪了挪，以减轻扭伤的脚腕子的负担。

sentences.english: I say, Bill, I've sprained my ankle .
sentences.chinese: 喂，比尔，我扭伤脚腕子啦。

definition: delicate hands/woman's tender and soft hands
to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
the five fingers of one's hand
